result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler W. Kurnat

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dodge County Detention Facility Inmate Request to Judge

14CF13, 14CF64 & 13CF196 - Defendant Tyler W. Kurnat in court, in custody with attorney Alexander Stormont.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Stormont heard on missed appearance. ADA Thompson heard. Court heard and sets $2500 Cash bond, same non-monitary conditions. P&S rescheduled to 9/16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
(9:34) 13CF196, 14CF13, 14CF64: Attorney Alexander Stormont appeared. Def. FTA for P&S; State appears by Yolanda Tienstra; Court authorizes warrant on all 3 cases
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.

13CF196, 14CF64 & 14CF13 - Defendant Tyler W. Kurnat in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Stormont heard as to status - will be accepting offer, requesting P&S. Court schedules.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on July 10, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Case called along with 13CF196 and 14CF13.  Yolanda Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alexander Stormont appeared.  The defendant did not appear.  Attorney Stormont indicated that the parties are in agreement with the Motion filed by the State.  ADA Tienstra requested a warrant be issued for the arrest of the defendant based on his failure to appear today.  She also amended her motion to include a deadline date for him to have the testing required done.  Attorney Stormont asked that the warrant be stayed until Friday at 4:30 PM.  The Court ordered the warrant is stayed until 4:00 PM on Friday, June 6, 2014.   Court inquired whether all three cases to be placed on the trial calendar.  Parties stated there is most likely a settlement agreement once the test results are received.  Cases recalled, defendant now appears in person.  Warrant is quashed.
Status conference on June 4, 2014 at 08:45 am.

(13CF196, 14CF13 & 14CF64) Defendant Tyler W. Kurnat in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  Yolanda J Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Review of info is waived in 14CF64; Arraignment is held in 14CF13 & 64; Def stands mute; Court enters not guilty plea; 20 days mtns; tsc set in all 3 cases; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 12:30 pm.
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant Tyler W. Kurnat in custody via video with attorney Jessica M. Moeller (will appoint).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 4/24/14 at 1:30pm in Br. 3; Court sets bond at $1,000.00 PA bonde with conditions: #2
